definition: Yuan Mei (1716-1798), famous Qing poet and critic, one of Three great poets of the Qianlong era 乾嘉三大家
long robe (old)
surname Yuan
classifier for coins, rings, badges, pearls, sporting medals, rockets, satellites etc/tree trunk/whip/wooden peg, used as a gag for marching soldiers (old)
surname Mei

sentences.english: Zhang Xuecheng's criticism to Yuan Mei was based on the difference of the poetical esthetics.
sentences.chinese: 章學誠對袁枚的批判，有來自詩學思想差異的因素。

sentences.english: He think the poesy's vitality and charm is the facticity of emotion.
sentences.chinese: 首先，情感創造的真實性是袁枚着重強調的。

sentences.english: Yuan Mei in the Qing dynasty to soul party, headed by is particularly emphasis on the soul.
sentences.chinese: 清代以袁枚爲首的性靈派，更是格外地強調性靈。

definition: Li Yu (1611-c. 1680), late Ming and early Qing writer and dramatist
Ji Yun (1724-1805), Qing Dynasty writer, author of supernatural novel Notes on a Minutely Observed Thatched Hut 閱微草堂筆記|阅微草堂笔记
Zhang Dai (1597-c. 1684), late Ming scholar
Wang Shizhen (1634-1711), early Qing poet
Gong Zizhen (1792-1841), Chinese man of letters, calligrapher and poet
Shen Fu (1763-c. 1810), Qing dynasty writer, author of Six Records of a Floating Life 浮生六記|浮生六记[Fu2 Sheng1 Liu4 Ji4]
Hong Liangji (1746-1809), poet and historian
Kong Shangren (1648-1718), Qing dramatist and poet, author of The Peach Blossom Fan 桃花扇[Tao2 hua1 Shan4]
Zhao Yi (1727-1814), Qing dynasty poet and historian, one of Three great poets of the Qianlong era 乾嘉三大家
Gu Yanwu (1613-1682), late Ming and early Qing Confucian philosopher, linguist and historian, played a founding role in phonology of early Chinese, author of Rizhilu or Record of daily study 日知錄|日知录
Su Dongpo, another name for Su Shi 蘇軾|苏轼 (1037-1101), northern Song writer and calligrapher
Li Boyuan or Li Baojia 李寶嘉|李宝嘉 (1867-1906), late Qing journalist, novelist and social observer, author of Observations on the current state of officialdom 官場現形記|官场现形记
Lu You (1125-1210), widely regarded as the greatest of the Southern Song poets
Pu Songling (1640-1715), author of 聊齋志異|聊斋志异[Liao2 zhai1 Zhi4 yi4]
Yuan Hongdao (1568-1610), Ming dynasty poet and travel writer
Li Ruzhen (c. 1763-c. 1830), Qing novelist and phonologist, author of fantasy novel Jinghua Yuan 鏡花緣|镜花缘 or Flowers in the Mirror
